cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (145 km) SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Yucatan Peninsula tonight, then north over the Gulf of Mexico, turning north-northeast on Wednesday toward the northern Gulf Coast and accelerating northeast across the southeastern United States, emerging offshore near the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast by early Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (roughly Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border. Tropical Storm Watch: MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL and west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA. Storm-Surge Watch: Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL including inland bays.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico (Yucatán). Tropical Storm Warning: South of Tulum to Punta Allen, and west of Dzilam to Progreso, Mexico.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA–FL Panhandle) Wednesday, then interior Southeast, Mid-Atlantic, and New England Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 20–30 mph late Thu-Fri.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Boston; surge threat confined to the northern Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain (locally up to 3 inches) possible Thu night–Fri, causing ponding on terminals and minor stream rises.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding of vulnerable shore roads and rough seas in Boston approaches Friday could hamper pilot transfers and cargo operations.
